In human anatomy, the 'superficial temporal artery' is a major artery of the
head. It arises from the external carotid artery when it bifurcates into the
superficial temporal artery and maxillary artery.

Its pulse is palpable superior to the zygomatic arch, anterior and superior to
the tragus.
categories: Arteries of the head and neck
